text: So nice tasting! But can this really be classified as malt liquor? The few of the style I have tasted had next to no hop aroma or flavor and this one is bursting with hoppy awesomeness. I really like it but I think it would be more fair to call it an India Pale Lager or something similar. I will rate is as style fitting though since I thinks its pretty good tasting.

Draught @ Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As The Veil The Struggle ].Hazy - murky matt - golden medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, grain, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, citrus, orange, fruity hops, fruity juice, peach. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity malt, fruity juice, orange, pale malt, fruity hops, grain, light floral. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20161229]
 7-3-7-3-15
Fine citrus aroma. Pine. Spices. Hoppy bite. Thick. Bitter. Not too boozy. Alrighty.

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grapefruit hoppy bitter aroma. Fruity malty grainy hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grapefruit hoppy bitter finish.

Draught at Omnipollos hatt. 
Hazy golden. 
Smooth and hoppy brew. Lots of grape seeds.

Draft at hatten 
Pale yellow, white head 
Aroma of peach, citrus, sour
Aroma taste fad, bittter. Old. No freshness. 
Herbal grass
Draught. Pours yellow with white head. Aroma and taste has notes of herbs and citrus. Really nice rich finish.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Draught @ Hatten. Hoppy, sweet, a bit sour and rather strong (altough not that alcoholic). Notes of citrus, orange cest and peach.

December 15, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is malty and fruity with grain, hints of wort, grass, hay, pine and citrus. Sweet malty with a light grassy bitterness. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Finish is sweet malty with grain and wort, light earthy grassy and herbal bitterness.

Aroma and taste is grassy and grainy, come citrus lemon notes, hay, some grassy and floral hoppy nuances into the close.

Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and grapefruity with some light citrus and grain.. Bitter and juicy citrus and grassy hops. Sweet malty notes and a semi-bitter finish.

Draught at Omnipollos Hatt. Almost clear golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, grain, corn, light wort and tangerine. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, grain and light wort. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty tasty, but not really a likka.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of straw, lemons, hops, fruit, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, fruit, hops, and a bit of spice, leading to a very bitter finish.
From tap at Warpigs. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw, fruit and bitterness.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and grapefruity. Crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Bitter, juicy. Lingering hoppy and fruity far finish.
